result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:17 AM Defendant Dean H. Danielson in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Dean H. Danielson.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Not called on the record. 
Atty Hoff requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:13 AM Defendant Dean H. Danielson in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marruffo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant acknowleges receipt of Amended Information and enters a not guilty plea. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED to Count 2.  Atty. Hoff made argument regarding bail motion.  State objects to motion.  For reasons as stated on the record, the Court denies the motion.  Defense requests another status date.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant's notice of motion and motion to  modify conditions of bond filed by Atty Hoff.

  **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on 07-21-2022: Stack on 7/22.**
Laboratory Report filed by the State
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:19 AM Defendant Dean H. Danielson in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:59 AM Defendant Dean H. Danielson in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Notice of Retainer.

Adjustment Number: 22A 017587,
Payable Number: 464234,
Amount: $20.00
Hearing on May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

01:04 PM Defendant Dean H. Danielson in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Herbers appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
